result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Kent Anderson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *Pay all remaining mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges within one (1) year or balance will convert to civil judgment.
*Defendant provided a receipt that the $300 was paid at the Clerk's Office.  The Court WAIVED restitution surcharges.  Statement from Defendant.  The Court DENIED restitution on the antique china.
*Pay all remaining mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges within one (1) year or balance will convert to civil judgment.
Concurrent with: With Count #1. With credit for TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS--TIME SERVED

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Kent Anderson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Refund Packet
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense.  The Court adjourned the matter in order for Defendant to go down to the Clerk's Office to pay the $300 restitution.  Matter recalled at 10:57am.  Defendant provided a receipt that the $300 was paid at the Clerk's Office.  The Court WAIVED restitution surcharges.  Statement from Defendant.  The Court DENIED restitution on the antique china.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve AS TO COUNT #1:  The Court ordered TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS--TIME SERVED.  

AS TO COUNT #2:  The Court ordered TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS CONCURRENT TO COUNT #1 in the House of Correction, with credit for TWENTY-THREE (23) DAYS--TIME SERVED with the following conditions:

1) Pay all remaining mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges within one (1) year or balance will convert to civil judgment;

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
The Court ORDERED that the Defendant go down to the Clerk of Court's Office - Criminal Division and pay restitution to Deondre E. in the amount of $300.00.  The Court WAIVED all fees and surcharges.

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  The Court is currently in trial and unavailable.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter is adjourned to January 14, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
received and filed.
received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with Attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  As to plea:  AS TO COUNTS #1 AND #2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court VACATED the November 18, 2015 Jury Trial date.  Matter is set for sentencing on December 2, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

CASE RECALLED AT 11:50AM AS DEFENDANT SHOWED UP LATE

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court with Defendant, Anthony Kent Anderson, Jr. (who appeared late).  Catelin Ringersma appeared (via telephone) for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Final-Pretrial Conference.  The Court WITHDREW the warrant that was entered for Defendant this morning.  The Court admonished the Defendant for his violations and for coming to court late.  The defense attorney indicated there may be resolution to this case.  The Court VACATED the October 28, 2015 calendar call date.  Matter is set for a final pre-trial on October 27, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court.  Defendant, Anthony Kent Anderson, Jr., NOT in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter is here for a Final Pre-Trial hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, the Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.  The Court ordered signature bond forfeited.  The Court ordered that the defendant be REMANDED to the trial court upon return on the bench warrant.  The Court set a calendar call date of October 28, 2015 to see if Defendant has been picked up yet.  No appearances needed for that hearing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed office contact), received and filed.

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a pretrial conference.  The jury trial date of October 26, 2015 has been adjourned.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.

Matter adjourned for a final pretrial conference on October 20, 2015 at 8:30am and a Jury Trial date of November 18, 2015 at 9:00am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report (missed telephone contact), received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial dates.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 08-26-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 09-28-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
Justice Point Pretrial Release Conditions Order; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to Justice Point for processing.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Anthony Kent Anderson not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

Court ordered the outstanding bench warrant WITHDRAWN.

Court addressed bail:  Statements made.  Court CONTINUED the $1,000.00 signature bond with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release remain as previously ordered.

Case adjourned to 06-29-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Scheduling Conference.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

- NO FILE IN COURT -
No appearances.

Matter in court for Justice Point Discharge Hearing.
Court received notice that the defendant is now discharged from Justice Point Pretrial Services.
Court ordered a bench warrant to issue.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

**No bail forfeited.

Case remains calendared for Status Conference on 06-10-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Justice Point Discharge Summary.
JusticePoint VIOLATION REPORT (missed telephone contact 5-18-15), filed.

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter for attorney Bridget Krause.  Timothy J. Cotter for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request an adjournment.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-10-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Status Conference.

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court on Atty. Kastenson's motion to withdraw as counsel for the defendant filed 04-21-2015.
Court GRANTS motion.
Atty. Daryl Kastenson is now discharged.
Atty. Kastenson is to ensure new counsel is appointed by the next court date.

Case adjourned to 05-12-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status of Counsel.
**Court CANCELED the 06-01-2015 at 8:30 AM status conference date before Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
filed by ADA Sarah McNutt on behalf of the State.  (Count #1 is modified to Burglary (Room) [a Class F FELONY], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.10(1m)(f), 939.50(3)(f).
to Withdraw as Attorney of Record filed by Atty. Daryl Kastenson.
filed by ADA Sarah McNutt on behalf of the State.
filed by ADA Sarah McNutt on behalf of the State.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Anthony Kent Anderson not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case adjourned along with case# 14CF5316.
Case adjourned to 04-30-2015 at 8:30 AM and 06-01-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Anthony Kent Anderson not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties still under negotiations.
Case adjourned to 02-17-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Status Conference.

- NO FILE IN COURT -
Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Anthony Kent Anderson not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Kastenson enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of the defendant.
Request for a speedy trial demand is noted for the record, however, the defendant is not eligible at this time.
Parties request a status conference date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 01-29-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Jacob Wasechek-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  (DEFENDANT WISHES TO ENTER A SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND IN THIS MATTER, HOWEVER, DEFENDANT IS NOT IN CUSTODY ON THIS CASE.)  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 6275 N DENMARK ST., MILWAUKEE, WI.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Anthony Kent Anderson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
